Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Overall, the service is exemplary, but my praise goes to the receptionist Daniele, on the 8th floor, block 5.My mother is very weak due to cancer. I was attended to by Daniele, who went to my mother to take her identification to put on her wrist. Daniele played with her which made her laugh and joke too. The scene marked me.When leaving, we passed by reception and my mother also played with Daniele.Being in a hospital is never good, but the reception makes all the difference for the patient and their families.Thanks.Kelly Duarte

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Yesterday, 12/02, I was at the Paulista Unit of Hospital Beneficência Portuguesa accompanying my husband, who was not feeling well, and I would like to record our positive experience. From reception and screening to clinical care, we were treated very efficiently and cordially.I especially highlight the service provided by Dr. Jorge Paiter, who was extremely attentive, demonstrating high professionalism and empathy from the first moment. He patiently listened to my husband's complaints, explained the diagnosis clearly and in detail, and carefully guided the treatment. This stance brought us security and confidence in a time of concern.I congratulate Dr. Jorge and the entire hospital team for their excellent service, which reflects the commitment to humanized and quality care.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: THEY PREFER TO GO TO SUS AND DO NOT RESPECT PRIORITY SERVICE.Very time consuming... I've been waiting 4 hours to be seen. Everyone has already passed in front of me. Even those with a green ribbon. It's of no use...I found the screening to be very dryAnd I am preferential (TEA). It's faster there.The other time I came I spent about 6 hours to be seenEdit: I spent 6h30 in the hospital!!!!The doctor who treated me is very good!!!But the general timekeeping is terrible

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I arrived at the first waiting stage and it was relatively empty. There were 4 people besides me. Over time, I realized that no one was called. With that, I started marking time. Several people arrived, until the place filled up to the point where several people were standing because there were no more chairs available. 47 minutes later I heard the first call.5 hours later I'm still here after carrying out a total of 1 laboratory test and with no plans to leave.I don't recommend it to anyone and I won't return to this place again.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I would like to register my dissatisfaction with the care provided at the hospital, which calls itself a reference, but is far from fulfilling this role.I arrived with my mother at the emergency room at around 4:45 pm, she was in intense pain, but we faced an absurd delay since opening the file. After hours of waiting, the need for hospitalization was informed, which only occurred at 2 am. During all this time, my mother had to wait in an old and unsanitary chair, until 4 am, in completely inadequate conditions.Furthermore, the care provided by a nursing technician was rude and hostile. When my mother asked about the room, which we are entitled to under the agreement, he responded in a disrespectful manner, which shows total disregard for the patient.To make matters worse, my mother has been waiting for a room for almost two days and, so far, has not been able to be transferred. She also did not have access to a bath during this period. The feeling is that we are in a real butcher's shop, such is the lack of preparation and disrespect towards others.If I had known about the chaos and terrible service provided by this hospital, I would have looked for a public hospital, where, at least, the service could be even more humanized.

Review Text: I performed an intravenous infusion of a medication at the BP Infusion Center. And there are individual rooms for each patient to carry out the Infusion with peace of mind. My vital signs were checked before and after the medication. The nurse and doctor came to guide me.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: We are from the interior of SP, we need medical attention for my son and we were very well attended to, we just have to thank and praise everyone, from the guy who helped us with getting our password, to the nursing team... exams and especially the Dr Loutdes Moya pediatrician... excellent service, attentive and helpful, solved our problem! Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I have been a BP patient for over 4 years and, during this time, I have always received very good service from the staff, which made me very satisfied with the services provided. However, I had two unpleasant experiences recently that I would like to report.I am 8 weeks pregnant and in the last few weeks I have had to have two obstetric ultrasounds. Unfortunately, on both occasions, I was treated with little empathy and a certain amount of ignorance by the professional responsible, which turned moments that should be happy and exciting into uncomfortable and stressful situations.I believe that situations like this do not match the standard of service that I have always found at BP. Therefore, I hope that this report can contribute to improving the service, especially in such significant moments for patients.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Terrible PS. The disorganization of the PS is glaring. ER staff ignore and dismiss patients when they turn their backs. The delay in hospitalization is absurd and the sector's culture regarding the well-being of sick people is grotesque.

Review Text: Unparalleled delay in emergency room care.Between passing the screening, taking 2 exams (which took less than 5 minutes each) and being seen by doctors again, it took more than 4 hours and 30 minutes to wait, which was absurd.I arrived at 5:53 pm and it is already 10:30 pm, still waiting for service.

Review Text: Disorganized, terrible service and hours waiting without service

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: The strategy developed by the hospital for emergency care could be reviewed. People go through screening, then open a form. They go to the doctor. As a rule, they will probably receive some medication and undergo some tests. So far, so good.After that, from what I understand, the patients' files all accumulate with the people who administer the medications and all go at once for reevaluation by another doctor. Not the one who received you and recommended medications or exams. But another doctor. Which is already counterproductive, in my opinion.And this way, everyone ends up spending practically the same amount of time in emergency care. The person who arrived, took medication and had an x-ray will stay the same time as the person who took the measurement and three or four more exams.I could be wrong but that was the observation I made today as a patient. If there is any justification for this procedure, which in my opinion is quite inefficient, I would like to know what it is.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I went to the emergency room at Benciência Portuguesa with my mother and we were treated extremely well. Wonderful nursing and medical staff!! Gratitude to Dr Marina, Dr Ecio, Dr Rafael from oncoclinics. Thank you for your attention and care!

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: One star is a lot for the exam withdrawal sector. On 11/12, I went to get the results of an MRI for my brother. On 10/30, I had already gone to take this exam, but even though I had called before and the sector employee, having said that I was within the deadline, when I got there, the employee Giovani, did not deliver the result, said that he was no longer in the exam. system, that I had to request it in writing and wait until 11/07 and that the employee who answered me on the phone was new and didn't know how to work. I didn't say anything. He had another exam to take, he said that at the end he would make the request. When he handed in the other exam, he pretended he forgot and I had to ask him to request it. I returned to my house. I live far away, in the metropolitan region. I had expenses, time and money. I return on the 12th, almost a week after the deadline, which was the 7th, I wait 35 minutes, several people pass in front of me and then an employee calls me and says that the exam was not in the system, it had not been requested, consequently, the department involved didn't send it, they were going to order it at that moment and I had to know that it would "take a while" (a little... 1 hour waiting). I went crazy, out of control, due to such negligence and incompetence on the part of those involved. Everyone in the sector confronted me, thinking my complaints were bad, another employee came from inside and stared at me. This Giovani said he was keen for me to complain to the management and even gave me his badge to show his name. I am 55 years old, I suffer from heart problems. What if I feel sick because I'm so nervous? Who will be responsible? And just like me, how many elderly and sick people go there and are poorly treated? What happened to this hospital, which WAS a reference? Today it is decadent. One employee worse than another. Lots of newbies. Uncompromising doctors. My family and I have been going to this hospital for years. From the beginning. Most of the doctors who worked and that we knew, have all left or are leaving. What remains? Doctors, nurses and employees with no experience, to take care of our health. If I were to count all the cases that have ever happened to me or to a family member or friend, I would type a book. And all this has been since 2022 and is only getting worse. It's very sad. An employee, who did not want to be identified, of course, said that complaints and grievances from patients are daily. In general. However, the exam withdrawal sector seems to want the trophy 🏆. I've also had horrible experiences at PS. But, I've also had great care, doctors, nurses, attendants, from the front desk, everything was impeccable. Only the memory remained 😢

Review Text: Top hospital. The emergency room is good, but depending on the time, it takes a long time. Sometimes it's quick and the service is usually good.The diagnostic center is one of the best in SP, and the exams are highly reliable and credible among doctors. Excellent structure and always wonderful service, in all the sectors I have worked in, from all the employees and teams. Very good cleaning and structure.The snack is one of the best too. But only fasting exams entitle you to the kit, this is the only negative point.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I was at BP Paulista today (06/11/24) for the first time to have an endoscopy,my experience was disappointing!How can a hospital of this level treat a patient with disrespect?I fasted for 17 hours (8pm to 1pm the next day) and waited practically 5 hours to take the exam.The exam was scheduled for 7:40 am, I entered the hospital at 7:36 am, I managed to get the password at 7:52 am.And I was informed that I was prevented from taking the exam, because I should have been there 1 hour before, but as I showed the attendant the messages sent via WhatsApp and SMS, they instructed me wrongly, in addition to not receiving any preparation guidance, I searched on Google how I should proceed .After I was outraged by the fact that the hospital wanted to transfer the responsibility for the error to me, they scheduled me for 11:40 am, insinuating that they were doing me a favor, even though I was upset, I explained my situation to the nurse who validates the forms at the exam reception, which is of little He did, he told me to go get my recording from the customer service center and see if the mistake was mine or theirs.In the end I was seen at 12:15 pm after my father made a complaint to another nurse, as I was thirsty and no one was attending to me, this kind nurse sped up the procedure when I had given up, due to dehydration from the fasting period.It took more than one hole to find the vein.The doctor and nurse who performed the procedure were rated 10, that was the reason for not giving zero stars.I hope that the hospital takes priority measures, people who were misguided, and does not punish them for their mistake (H BP) as in my case, in addition to the deprivation of food and water, I had to reckon with this lack of cordiality, not to mention the cost of parking which was another punishment.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I have nothing but praise for the Children's PS, the doctors who are helpful and committed to actually evaluating the child. Today we were seen at the PS by Dr. Márcia Pretti Bueno and I want to record our satisfaction with all the care and attention given to our son. I hope that good professionals like her are increasingly easier to find so that this calms our afflicted hearts.My son had a colic attack at the time she was being discharged, so she backed away and went back with him to the medication room, she didn't use the phrase: virus. But he was concerned with examining, collecting exams and reevaluating as many times as necessary.Thank you very much to everyone from reception, technicians and nurses.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I have been with my husband (an associate for over 40 years) twice during his hospitalization, in August and now in October, totaling almost 50 days. If it weren't for the medical and nursing staff, I would give this hospital zero. What happened to the excellence of this hospital?Terrible cleaning service. We spent 1 and a half days without any cleaning, neither in the bathrooms nor in the room. And if the shower was after the pseudo-cleaning, we would stay in the water in the bathroom.The food was unbearable, and I'm the daughter of immigrants, used to eating everything. My husband spent the last 10 days eating absolutely nothing, apart from breakfast and afternoon coffee. And there were times when the water was gone!!!! Water!!!The laundry, not to mention. They often delayed bathing the patient because there was no linen available to change the patient's bed. As a companion, I needed to take mine from home.On election day, there was only one nurse to attend the entire floor. In fact, actually on Sundays, poor nurse who attended. He worked almost alone.It would be better to put up a sign so that no one needs hospital services on Sundays.Not to mention the delay in the arrival of medicines from the pharmacy.Now, phones are a separate thing. Try making an appointment at the membership section to find out what is terrible.Finally, there's a question. Is this poor service just for members, or is it specific to the hospital?Ana Maria Eivazian

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil

Review Text: I live at JD Angela. My 14-year-old daughter had sinusitis, and I stopped taking her to Ama do Figueira Grande, to take her to the Benef Portug hospital. due to the fact that I had the company's agreement and thought that the service would be faster. Unfortunately, from the bad manners and rudeness of the receptionists (they didn't let my daughter use the bathroom at the first entrance, claiming that she would only be able to enter at the next entrance), to the absurd delay in waiting for service (more than 2 hours for the first service ), everything left something to be desired. Dozens of people complaining about the delay! For a moment I got confused, thinking I was in love! Regrettable!! I can say that I will think a thousand times next time, before leaving JD Angela, to go to a hospital through the agreement. Honestly it's not worth it.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: The worst care I've received in an emergency room, including public hospitals, has been recorded. I arrived feeling unwell, the ER was empty and it took me an hour and twenty to be seen by a doctor, which is normal. Then she asked for an x-ray, which I waited an hour and a half for and was not seen. I asked the receptionist twice who informed me that I would be next, but the next one never arrived. I questioned the x-ray technician who said my name was not in the system! The receptionist lost the physical route and couldn't find the digital one in the system. I tried to speak to the hospital Ombudsman, another wallflower. I left indignant and I would not recommend this experience to anyone. If you have a choice, go somewhere else!

Reviewer: Daiane J. N. de Castro Queiroz (Dai-DQ)
Review Text: TERRIBLE, I WOULD GIVE IT A 0 IF GOOGLE HAD THIS RATING:On 10/26/24, I had an appointment scheduled with Angiology/Vascular Surgery (Dr. Sayonê Andrade de Moura), in which I arrived at the Hospital at 8:20 am and my file was opened at 8:32 am Totem Service Number ACM31.When opening the file, the attendant Matheus was surprised by the scheduled appointment with this doctor and asked his co-worker next to window 1 if Dr. Sayonê would be attending that day and his colleague said yes.I signed the form and the attendant (Matheus) asked me to wait to be called. (Note that on that day, the system was constantly failing, which caused problems with patient calls from doctors and counters, not to mention the panels that started to shut down).I was waiting to be called from 8:32 am to the opening of the form and when it was 10:47 am, I was surprised by the delay, since I was already 47 minutes late for my appointment. I went to the counter to speak to the attendants and was attended by Ana Collino, who said that a problem had occurred and Dr. Sayonê would not be attending that day and that this doctor had only informed her at the last minute and that they were talking to her via message via (Whatsapp) and that the doctor Sayonê said that she would be sending 2 work colleagues to provide care to her patients, who were scheduled with her that day, this was what the attendant Ana Collino herself told me and the others patients and that's what I heard again, her talking to attendant Matheus, that the doctor would be sending these doctors to replace her and they asked me and the other patients to wait.We waited. until the attendant, Ana Collino, called us and took us to another location and said that Dr. Sayonê canceled her schedule and had not informed us anything in advance and that no doctor would replace her, that we would have to reschedule the appointment.In this regard, we complained about the negligence and lack of professional ethics of this doctor, since the other patients, including a lady who needed to change her complaint, had informed that it was not the first time, that this doctor canceled her appointments, that the situation It is recurrent and apparently Hospital Beneficência does not take any action.I want action taken against the doctor who cancels her appointments at the last minute and the attendants, who knew from the moment I arrived that this doctor wouldn't come and even so, they made me wait 2 hours there.I also want to be reimbursed for the cost of transportation I had, since my husband who brought me had to travel from our house in Barueri to BP and I'm not even going to charge for our time, which is more valuable and we lost due to the negligence of the doctor and everyone else. BP service team. I await a response on this.

Review Text: Praise for Dr. Juliana Cristina Pacheco and TeamI would like to express my deep gratitude to Dr. Juliana Cristina Pacheco and her team for their excellence, competence and care during the thyroidectomy procedure that I performed 10 days ago.From the first consultation, I was welcomed with great empathy and dedication. His professionalism and the way he accompanied me throughout the process gave us peace of mind and confidence, something fundamental in moments like this.The meticulous care taken with every detail of the surgery was remarkable. Dr. Juliana made a point of requesting the use of the nerve and vocal cord monitoring device, which guaranteed an even safer and more accurate procedure. Today, I can say that the surgery was an absolute success, not only because of the impeccable technique, but also because I didn't have any complications with my voice or any other post-operative aspect.The recovery has been excellent, and this is the result of Dr. Juliana's careful work and expertise. I would also like to thank your team, who treated me with so much care and attention during my hospitalization, always attentive to my needs and the well-being of my family. Everyone's commitment made all the difference, and for that, I am immensely grateful.I heartily recommend Dr. Juliana and her team, who, in addition to being highly qualified, demonstrated extraordinary humanity.Signature:Kelly PerezPatient

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I have been using the services of the Portuguese charity for years and I can say, with certainty, how much the Emergency Care has fallen in quality in recent times. Of the three visits to the PA this year, two of them as a patient and one as a companion, all were terrible in terms of waiting time: it took 5 hours waiting for care! Other people in the queue were waiting even longer, with no response from the service teams and medical staff.This last time it was no different, the office doors were left ajar and no patients entered; the waiting time between one person and another is 30 to 40 minutes, and there is no justification given. They said there were 4 professionals attending and the volume of patients was high, but only two professionals were seen attending, something very similar to other visits to this hospital this year.This time, the doctor had to move to another office because there were no basic materials to examine the ear and throat.In the queue, a lady with a priority bracelet gave up after waiting 3h30, and a young woman with pain in her intestine and kidney also gave up after waiting 1h, having already vomited in pain. The disrespect is absurd. And to improve, the medical prescription and certificate are being sent via an app, not printed, which makes access difficult, in this case my certificate was not sent and I have been waiting for hours for the hospital to forward it.I have the utmost respect for the infirmary teams, all health professionals in general, whether they are care workers or doctors, and working in the hospital for medical consultations is very interesting -- what happens here is terrible management of the Emergency Room service, lack of conditions for good qualified care with agility and respect for those who are sick, and if applicable, decent conditions for those who are working.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I had a bad experience donating blood at BP on 9/11. I filed a complaint with Gustavo at the Ombudsman's Office and to date I have not received a position on the case.The nurse (identified as Carla by the ward leader) attended to me without attention, forgot to loosen the tourniquet, pierced her arm wrong, and kept talking to her colleague about her dissatisfaction with days off and shifts. I've been a donor for 30 years and I've never seen a case of a donor not being "careful" when donating. The nurse didn't look at my face once.It went wrong. It hurt, it turned purple, it bled.I went out and called to complain. I asked to speak to the person responsible and spoke to Shirlei. She answered the phone with the phrase "Do you have something very important that you can't help but share with me?" It's strange. I found all the treatment given over the phone strange. . . until I said that I would like to hear from the Ombudsman. Then she changed her tone and tried to redo the service with professionalism. . . but it was already too late.I sent a message to the Ombudsman's Office and spoke to Gustavo on the 11th. He said he had already received the message about the problem with my service. I said my arm was hurting and he said I would receive an answer in 7 days.I didn't hear back until Saturday and I sent a photo of my purple arm on Saturday via WhatsApp. I had no response on Saturday, Sunday or Monday.On Tuesday 17/09 in the morning he wrote to me asking how my arm was doing. I sent another photo showing that it was still purple, but less so.He asked me to go to the hospital and said that the leadership was worried about my arm... really? They're worried about my arm and haven't made contact for a week? They could have called me between September 11th and 17th or they could have gone to my house if the concern was real.There are very good people at the hospital (like the reception and triage team), but I found the nurse responsible for the donation, the head of nursing and the Ombudsman to be indifferent and passive.I don't expect this as a donor, a situation where the hospital needs me and I am a volunteer.I also don't think about going back to the hospital in a situation where my life depends on them. They didn't seem concerned about people or their well-being.I encourage everyone to donate blood, but I suggest another bank. I have never had a lack of care problem like this in 30 years as a voluntary donor.DONATE BLOOD, BUT CHOOSE A PLACE THAT RESPECTS PEOPLE.EDITED ON 09/21.- Only after opening Reclame Aqui and evaluating it on Google did Mr. Antonio from the Ombudsman get in touch saying that he had legal support to defend the 7 days for a response. In an exhausting process, I was unable to make myself understood and gave up without any more patience.The photo is from 7 days after the donation.I complained to give BP a chance to recover from its poor service SO I CAN CONTINUE DONATING TO BP.Donating blood is an act of love.I hope BP understands that a hospital needs voluntary blood donations. To achieve this, the hospital needs to create conditions of well-being for voluntary donors. Hospital patients need this.Perhaps one option is to join a good blood bank that respects the donor.The voluntary donor donates out of love.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I was admitted to the ICU and then to the 3rd floor of BP tower V due to a Vertebral Artery Dissection on September 10th at 5pm. I passed the screening, explained the case to the nurse, I needed to be admitted to undergo a skull MRI in the emergency room to confirm the diagnosis. The triage 01 nurse simply put on a blue bracelet, meaning my case was serious and I was classified as not serious. Within 1 hour, by God and by the employee in the corridor at Rosa triage, I was seen and the doctor questioned the person who had received the blue bracelet in my case.Other than that, the service was spectacular in the PS, in the PS ICU where the technicians were spectacular. In the General ICU mainly by Nursing technicians Iago and Luiz, excellent professionals. The medical team at the general ICU, Neurology - Antonio Netto and the Cardiology team were fantastic. In the apartment on the 3rd floor I was very well looked after, the Thainá technician applied the clexane in such a way that I didn't even feel any pain, the technicians on the floor were very professional and top notch. It's a shame that on the 15th I didn't receive a visit from the floor nurse. Today I'm home and have no after-effects. I will continue treatment with Neurology and Cardiology at BP via Outpatient.I just reinforce that the screening needs to be more accurate in stratifying cases because I needed urgent monitoring. Thank God nothing bad happened.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: The emergency service is out of 10, from the security guard to the medical team. For your attention and cordiality. I had to stay in the hospital for 6 days. The rating I leave for the nursing and medical team is 3. Treating the patient cannot be the only focus of professional care. My nutrition concerns and existing illnesses were ignored and I went through a lot of trouble during my hospitalization. I became malnourished and dehydrated. I lost about 6 kg. But they didn't care. My heart began to show signs of decompensation that I was told were due to anxiety. They wanted to give me Rivotril, but I would have relaxed and slept with dehydration if I had taken it. This is very dangerous. I'm in the healthcare field. If he had been a lay person he probably would not have survived. And according to the ombudsman, my report is not included in the medical report. What are they trying to hide? Four times there was cardiac decompensation, after a lot of conversation, I was offered intravenous serum. How was anxiety treated with serum? After my slight recovery, I started eating and drinking water. And then I told the nursing team this. The person looked at my two visitors and said to them "I convinced her to eat, you have to try, right". It's the first time in a hospital complex that they mocked me for my health condition. Are you trying to make me nervous enough to take this to court? Before, I couldn't eat or drink water because I was having a very strong reflux that came out in the form of jets. All the nursing and medical professionals knew that I was eating very poorly due to this reflux problem. They just told me that I should make more effort to eat and drink water. How am I going to eat and drink water if I have severe reflux all the time, day and night? All the professionals told me to follow a protocol. But what protocol is this that doesn't even provide the basics for a person who is suffering from reflux and can't drink water, because everything they drink comes out with strong reflux? There is a danger of bronchoaspiration. What is this protocol that waits for the patient to become weak and then offers the serum after seeing them feeling unwell instead of taking preventive measures and maintaining the physical condition that the patient has had since the beginning? I was traumatized by the hospital care. I don't have health insurance, I use the SUS and I entered this hospital as a private individual. For a daily rate equivalent to a 6-star hotel, receiving this professional support fell short of my expectations.

Review Text: NEVER SET YOUR FEET IN THIS HOSPITAL!Last week, I started feeling sick and was diagnosed with arrhythmia. Unfortunately, I got worse and had to seek help at BP's emergency room. Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I came to BP yesterday, August 30, 2024, on a Friday, I checked in at 5:30 pm.With an unusual headache, which had been there since Tuesday, my head hurt so much that the pressure from the glasses resting on my nose made me want to cry, for a myopic person who even uses glasses to take a shower, saying that is because it was difficult same.I did the screening and opened the form...After waiting hours, and it wasn't busy, they called me and I was seen, I didn't do any tests, the doctor said it was a migraine with sinusitis.A doctor who didn't ask any questions about my medical history at all...When I asked about having been prescribed an antibiotic that I already tried to use at another time, she didn't even listen to me... I asked again about giving me only dipyrone for the pain, she said she would give me a Tramal along with it, without much importance.I was treated and everything went well.Leaving the hospital it was almost 11pm.At the pharmacy I discovered that she didn't prescribe Tramal, just dipyrone. I'm already irritated.I woke up in the morning with pain, I took the dipyrone and nothing... After 3 hours I took another... No success with the pain.The next morning my glasses bothered me again... Because of the pressure I was putting on my face... I thought I'd better go back to BP to get the prescription, after all it hadn't been 12 hours since I left there and it was in the system that I had used more than one pain medication.To my surprise... I had to do the whole process again... I would need a new evaluation, due to the doctor's typographical error.In short, another 4 hours inside the hospital, and the triage girl was so cute and gave me an emergency classification due to everything that happened.I waited for the doctor to re-evaluate me, he clearly disagreed with the previous doctor's conduct, he needed to change all the medicines she gave me, he said that with a history of sensitive stomachs, this antibiotic is not recommended, as it would cause damage, he changed the pain medicine, removed it the anti-inflammatory and added 2 types of corticosteroids, via mouth and inhalation.He was very attentive and actually listened to me.I hope it gets better now.I would really like the doctor to pay me what I spent at the pharmacy, for medicines that were not useful to me.A very big disregard for the patient, as it was clear that she wasn't listening to what she was saying... Regrettable.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Fast, efficient, polite, respectful and empathetic service. I've never been to a better hospital. It stood out!

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I underwent varicose vein surgery on 09/06/2023 with Dr Fábio Haddad. I was very disappointed, on the day of the surgery I was only received by the assistants in the surgical center. They told me that Dr Fábio was passing a catheter to another patient and that he would come for my surgery afterwards... I never saw him... The worst of all was the ANESTHESIST, whose name I don't remember, I just I remember the strong smell of cigarettes. He performed general anesthesia, because the herniated discs I have did not indicate spinal anesthesia. When he injected the medication into my vein and asked me to take a deep breath, I stopped breathing, I couldn't speak or move. I only managed with a lot of effort to throw my right leg off the stretcher, the worst feeling of my life! I wanted to run away.... He started telling me that everything was fine... but it was horrible! Then I fell asleep and when I woke up there was no doctor on Dr Fábio's team, nor the anesthetist who smelled like cigarettes... there was only another anesthetist. What a great scare, what a lack of responsibility!Talking to another anesthesiologist, he told me that the medications were taken together, but the medication that stops breathing should only be given when the patient is sleeping.  Dr Fábio was questioned when he returned to the office and he couldn't tell me what happened... of course he wasn't there... disappointing!

Review Text: The hospital invention called VIRTUAL BED for companions is simply a joke. They ask patients and companions to arrive at the hospital at 5 am to leave companions in a room with no space for all companions -- companions who forget that they are in a hospital and treat the VIRUTAL BED like a living room at home. I arrived at 5 am to hear from my mother-in-law at 10 am in a room with no space at all, no space available to charge devices, etc., in which I will still wait another 1h30 for a room to be available. At 10:09 there is simply no space for more people inside the so-called VIRTUAL BED, with many patients coming with 2, 3 or more companions and others using two chairs to sleep. Wouldn't it be better to leave the companions at home and ask to come to the hospital only after the surgery? A lack of care, a huge lack of care for those who are accompanying a patient and they will still have a long day. I hope I never set foot in that hospital again.

Review Text: If it were possible to give 0 stars I would.My wife is 32 weeks pregnant with severe migraines, vomiting and clearly feeling very ill. The PS was empty and the triage was very quick. Due to her condition, they have already taken her to the medication room for the doctor to evaluate on the spot (in my opinion, a pregnant woman who clearly couldn't even sit up should be in a bed and not on the horrible, dirty chairs in the medication room, but that's ok).We waited more than 40 minutes for the doctor to evaluate us and no one gave any information. As the case was simple, the doctor quickly said what medication it would be. I thought everything was resolved. It took another 40 minutes for the medicine to arrive. Several new patients already taking medication and the PREGNANT WOMAN without priority being left behind. When I went to ask the nurse if her file had already arrived because the doctor had already been there a while ago, the nurse was very rude and rude as if my question was the biggest absurdity on the planet and that the question was DELAYING HER.This hospital used to be good. Now unfortunately it is scrapped, with few (and bad) professionals. If you can avoid it, avoid it.

Review Text: Today, 07/29/2024, I was admitted to the PS at 1:30 pm - screening code AD74 - NA: 17344963I came with symptoms of: fever, body pain, bitter mouth, thick saliva, burning eyes, abdominal pain that spreads to the back, nausea, excessive cold, vomiting and liquid diarrhea.I am writing this message at 9:37 pm, withdrawing from my service. That's because:1. The delay was unimaginable from one service to the next;2. I spent the day without eating breakfast or lunch, and they didn't give me an estimate as to whether or not I could eat, even feeling weak;3. I had the ultrasound late in the afternoon and waited until 8pm to get to office 7 in flow 3, where the doctor told me that I didn't have the report available yet. In the end, a girl wearing a vest and black pants, who transports patients from one side to the other, informed me that the team does not have my report, much less the image of the exam.Obviously, I was very angry with the situation and went to remove the access to leave. A very friendly nurse tried to help me, looking for something new, but in the end I was back to square one and she asked me to wait in a room.I don't know what I have, I don't have a diagnosis, I'm just in pain and tired. It's ridiculous how a hospital with such a well-made structure has such a lack of respect for a patient.I write this because I refuse to accept that the health plan is charged for an exam that was never completed and properly reported.I filed a complaint with the ombudsman and I'm posting it here as an extra guarantee for them to respond.

Review Text: I had a catheterization and didn't feel anything!! Then revascularization surgery with the Januário Team!! Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: My grandson had successful heart surgery, but he died during the transfusion. He caught hemorrhagic dengue and died on his birthday. If we had known that there was a possibility, we could have waited longer, but they didn't warn the family about this risk.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: My nephew, Lucca Enrico De Bellis, passed away on 07/06/2024 due to hospital incompetence! You can look on the TJSP website, his injunction was granted to have the surgery at BP, as they were the best doctors for the disease he had: Left Ventricular Hypoplasia Syndrome. He was hospitalized on 05/28/2024, had surgery on 06/27/2024, but on 07/01/2024 he was diagnosed with dengue, due to a transfusion with contaminated blood! The hospital did not provide any support to the family, especially his parents and his 9-year-old brother. Incompetence and neglect. There had already been three other cases of death from dengue due to blood transfusion. I hope that my nephew is no longer one of the statistics and that his case helps to prevent further deaths for the same reason.

Review Text: In the last two months I had the opportunity to take my mother and brother to the emergency room. My mother underwent several tests, all of which were carried out very carefully and my brother had to be hospitalized due to dengue fever which developed into acute pancreatitis. They are both doing well now, thanks to the team of doctors and nurses at BP. My brother had a bit of trouble with some rude nurses who thought he was acting soft, when he was actually very ill and unable to stand up. The doctors also took a long time to identify his pancreatitis and this caused my brother for two days of discomfort and a lot of pain, but after they identified the problem, it was quickly treated and everything went well. Hence the positive evaluation. We cannot belittle the credit of the hospital that follows strict care protocols because of one or another professional who clashes with the others. In general, we were very well attended to by everyone with cordiality and friendliness. I thank everyone.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: My mother and I took my uncle, who lives with other family members and who is somewhat vulnerable due to memory problems, for a consultation because we discovered, in addition to memory lapses, an injury on his leg. We rushed to the emergency room and we were all treated. My mother and I, the only people in the family willing to help her brother and who were unaware of his condition, were treated by Dr. Swami and nurses as people who were neglecting his health, questioning us and making faces when we explained the situation. , as if we knew about his condition and weren't taking care of him. We were seen by Dr. Swami Cervone de Oliveira (CRM 68705) who treated us completely badly throughout the consultation. He threw the prescription sheets in disgust and said loudly in front of the patient that he “was very relaxed”, being totally anti ethical and unprofessional (this applies to any profession, let alone a doctor). We asked for a referral from the Dr. to have the wound bandaged, since we were in the hospital (and paying privately, by the way) and he, treating us as if we were neglecting my uncle's health and asking for a favor, responded to us as if We wanted the hospital to take care of him, not ourselves. After, withstanding a lot of arrogance, we got the referral to do the dressing, we stood in the hallway and could hear the nurse, Tatiana Santos, who entered the room to do the dressing, complaining and repeating “Jesus Christ”, again as if we were neglecting our health him and asking for a favor. It is worth mentioning that my mother, discovering that her brother was in these conditions, cut his hair at home (as he refused to go out), bought new clothes and took him to the hospital, the way they treated us and on top of that hear A DOCTOR saying in a tone of ARROGANCE that the PATIENT was “WELL ALREADY. We will take legal action to ensure that this situation no longer occurs in a HOSPITAL environment.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I was admitted to this hospital with my father and overall I can say that everything was in order. One or another shift that clashed negatively with the others, with delays at the pharmacy, delays in medication. But the good nurses did their best to make everything go well. Unfortunately, not all professionals acted like this.Another point to highlight if I could give a grade would be minus zero, the withdrawal of exams, I was there waiting for 4 hours, I have never seen this anywhere. Arrive at 3:00 pm and leave at almost 7:00 pm to get a sheet of paper. People passing in front of you, and you questioning them and being simply ignored, lack of respect is not enough for this sector that needs to improve a lot. It's no wonder there was a lot of shack because no one could take it anymore, including the employees themselves (doctors included) who went there to get an exam and also talked a lot.Sorry, I have nothing to say about the SUS on this, I think it would be good to undergo training with the public network.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I started going to the hospital in 2019, and since then I have always received very good care. It is a clean, organized and visually pleasing hospital. Sometimes there may be delays if the PS is full, but this happens in the city of São Paulo, the difference is that at BP, even if it takes a while, you will be well attended to. If your case is serious, you will have priority, as happened to me in 2020, I had pulmonary sepsis and I believe that my survival is partly due to the quick action of the PS team. I needed to use the PS again in 2024 and I received very good service, from reception to consultation. The clinical doctor referred me to the ENT and without delay I was seen, examined, advised, without the need to open another file. I highly recommend it.

Review Text: I got ransom from this joint, terrible management, they work with quantity and never quality, my mother had hemodialysis earlier today at this hospital, she had a cough, the hemodialysis doctor sent her to the ER of the hospital itself, because they punished my mother who had already She is 92 years old, she stayed from ten o'clock in the morning, until the end of the afternoon, to do tests and ended up being hospitalized because she had Pneumonia, and they didn't put her in the room, because there is no vacancy, and she has the right to a private room, as it is in a box in the infirmary, every time to admit her, they leave her waiting like this, sometimes for days, then we have to give a shit, go and complain, to see if manifest a room for her.For love, let's work on quality and not quantity, stop overcrowding, where you don't have the capacity to put the patient in the room.I think the management of this hospital needs to change, which unfortunately is terrible.

Review Text: Hoje, 17/06/24, na Beneficência Portuguesa, além de o atendimento da recepção da ortopedia, não estar funcionando, por causa "do sistema ", causando muito atraso, deparei-me com a situação de ter que usar sanitário unissex, porque não tem mais sanitário feminino e masculino, separadamente. Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Worst experience I've ever had in a hospital in my entire life. I do not recommend this hospital for hospitalization and surgery. My minor daughters had adenoid surgery on June 14th at Hospital Beneficência Portuguesa, the surgery went without any problems, the problems started after the surgery. They put my eldest daughter in a room with a crib instead of a bed, a seven-year-old child had to stay in a cramped crib, they took food that even dogs don't eat and they left a bottle of water without glasses. After my second daughter's surgery, they wanted to put them in a separate room since they are sisters and there was no way to keep them both in separate rooms. Not to mention that my daughters had been fasting since 8:30 pm the day before and on the day of the surgery it was already 4 pm and my youngest daughter was still not eating as they were checking the issue of the separate room. It's absurd for a five-year-old and a seven-year-old to go so long without eating. I had to take my daughter out of the recovery area on my own and buy a snack for both of us to eat, as I hadn't eaten since four in the morning. I had a horrible day and a horrible experience with this hospital. In the end, they didn't change my daughters' room, they didn't put them together in the same room, I had to ask the doctor for discharge, otherwise I would leave on my own. Not to mention that when you arrive you go to pre-hospitalization where there is no place to store your things, I had to go up to the surgical center with backpacks and bags to accompany my daughters and there is the risk of contamination. Unlike other hospitals that accommodate you in rooms or infirmaries to store your things. The only good thing was the medical team, excellent professionals that I have nothing to say about.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Customer service from the team is terrible, not to mention health professionals, such as doctors, technicians and nurses.But from the ombudsman and treasury.I was wrongly charged for a procedure, and I have difficulty resolving the problem.

Review Text: I've always had great service!

R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Crowded children's emergency room, with an average waiting time for medical care of 4 hours. Absurd!

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: BP is recognized as a hospital of excellence, but everything indicates the opposite. I came for the first time in 2022, I needed to go to the ER and from screening to seeing the doctor it took less than 30 minutes. Now in 2024, perhaps it is poor management or administrative changes, there is total disregard for patients! There are a lot of patients, but the triage and counter part was quick, the problem was the service, the emergency room itself. On the sign, it is written that there are 10 (TEN) OFFICES, the employees think that we are not paying attention, but you can clearly see that they see a patient (average of 10 minutes) and are IDLE for at least 30 minutes! They are very busy and the queue only gets longer! Several patients have already complained about the delay and just choose to ignore it. A lack of respect for patients, seriously, that doesn’t exist!! Everything is expensive, the consultation, the PS, health plan and they treat us that way. I arrived at the hospital at 2:30 pm and now it's 6:00 pm and they still haven't called me. Worst of all, there are patients who are giving up on emergency room appointments because they take too long. There are elderly people, there are people in wheelchairs, everyone waiting and nothing. The doctors know that there is a long waiting list, but obviously they are not the ones waiting, so they practically don't care.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I was in the emergency room, and for the first time in this hospital, I had the flu symptom password removed (I had a fever, cough, sneezing and nasal congestion). I was treated in nursing, one of the technicians was in training, and the “trainer” was rude, I understand that the hospital was in high demand, but those who are sick are not there because they want to, and rudeness is what helps the least. When I was called at the reception, the attendant confirmed that he would open orthopedics service, I said no, that it was a medical clinic and I told him the symptoms, he said that the nursing team referred me to orthopedics with the justification of knee pain (????? ), asked me to go to the screening, which I went through to ask for a change, I went and there was just a rough technique, no patient, I talked about the password being at the orthop and that I needed to change it to the clinic, and she said she had already done it. From reception I was taken to a waiting room, where there was a counter with 2 people who looked like customer service assistants, I asked if I was on the correct waiting list, the attendant didn't even look at me and said yes. After about 30 minutes, this same attendant said that I should be redirected to another waiting area, as I was in the wrong place, I asked if the doctor had already called my password, she said no, as I was in the wrong place, and that the service The orthopedic clinic wasn’t there, I said I wouldn’t go to an orthopedist but rather a medical clinic, the rude attendant said “KNEE PAIN COMES TO AN ORTHOPEDIST, MA’AM!” in a rude and loud tone, I didn't even have time to respond, she continued talking about where I should go, I said that I wouldn't go, that my care was at a medical clinic, and again she interrupted me, until the doctor left the room and She asked me why I was being treated, I explained the symptoms and that I had already asked for a change in the triage, as the error was there, and I was only being sent to orthop as the next one for treatment was mine, kindly, the doctor asked for me to enter the room and that she would attend to me, and so it was done.There are certain errors that are intolerable, and this is one of them, if only the attendant had LISTENED, she would have known that the symptom described was an error on the part of one of her colleagues, and would have avoided further inconvenience. There is a lack of patient experience training for the team, I have seen situations of rudeness towards other people too, the attitude of some employees is regrettable.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I WAS AT BP'S CHILDREN'S PS ON 06/09/2024 TO CARE FOR MY DAUGHTER WHO HAD RED SPOTS ON THE BODY. I CHECKED IN AT 3:58 PM AND WE WERE RELEASED AT AROUND 10:00 PM. DUE TO THE DELAY IN SERVICE, I ASKED DR MARCELO PAIVA CURY, CRM 109026, HOW CALLS CONTROL WAS BEING DONE SINCE IT HAD ALREADY BEEN WAITING FOR 6 HOURS AND NOBODY CALLED MY DAUGHTER FOR RE-ASSESSMENT. THE MENTIONED DOCTOR JUST REPLYED THAT HE WAS TO WAIT FOR THE CALL, I INSISTED ALLEGING THE EXAGERATED WAITING TIME. AND HE RESPONDED RUSHLY TO WAIT. I SAID THAT MY DAUGHTER'S EXAM HAD BEEN READY FOR MORE THAN 2 HOURS AND NOBODY CALLED. DR MARCELO AT THAT MOMENT, IN FRONT OF ALL THE PARENTS WHO WERE IN THE WAITING ROOM, SPEAKED TO THE SECURITY GUY, POINTING TO ME "CLEAN THE ENVIRONMENT HERE", WANTING TO TELL THE SECURITY GUY TO GET ME OUT OF THERE. I ASKED IF HE WAS CALLING ME TRASH AND DEMANDED THAT HE RESPECTED ME. I ASKED FOR HIS NAME BUT HE TURNED HIS BACK TO ME AND WALKED TO THE SERVICE ROOM. IN ADDITION TO THE ILL EDUCATED BEHAVIOR OF THE DOCTOR, WHO WITHOUT ANY EMPATHY FOR THE TIME AND TIREDNESS OF THE LONG WAITING, I NOTICED THAT BP HAS ASSIGNED A VASCULAR SURGEON TO ATTEND THE CHILDREN'S PS, WHICH IS UNACCEPTABLE, BECAUSE WE, PARENTS, BELIEVE WE ARE CARE FOR BY PEDIATRICIANS. MY DAUGHTER IS 12 YEARS OLD AND AT THE AGE OF 5 MONTHS SHE HAD A SKIN INJURY AND WAS HELPED AT BP AND FROM THEN ON, DUE TO THE EXCELLENT CARE, WHENEVER SHE NEEDED IT, SHE ONLY WAS AT THIS HOSPITAL, WHERE I HAD MY COMPLETE CONFIDENCE. HOWEVER, I REALIZE THAT OVER THESE 12 YEARS THE PROFESSIONAL QUALITY OF DOCTORS IN PEDIATRICS, WITH A FEW EXCEPTIONS, HAS BEEN DECREASING ABSURDLY.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I was scheduled to undergo a colonoscopy exam at this hospital at 4:20 pm today. To perform this test, you must take a laxative for 2 days and fast for 18 hours. Anyway, I arrived at the hospital 1 hour before the exam time, as required, I opened my file, was taken to my bed and I'm waiting until now (7:01 pm) to take an exam that was supposed to be done at 4:00 pm: 20 p.m. Not eating, feeling sick, after 2 days of laxatives. The hospital's justification is that it does not have enough anesthetists to meet patient demand and that, although the nursing team complains, nothing changes.If you are considering taking an exam here, whether privately or through an agreement, I suggest you look elsewhere. One that respects the demands of patients, the time of patients and the suffering that each patient finds themselves in (whether due to illness or due to the preparation suffered for exams).I hope someone from hospital management reads this and has empathy and is embarrassed.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: An excellent hospital with wonderful doctors and nurses. Special thanks to nurses Vânia and Adriana, from the angiography area, who treated my mother with great care and affection. Thank you very much!

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I am 33 weeks pregnant and have positive serology for dengue. Yesterday 05/02, after a worsening of symptoms, with bleeding and abdominal pain, I was referred to the PS. Unfortunately, I chose the PS at the São Paulo unit.  I arrived at 6:50 pm The wait between screening and registration was over an hour. I received an emergency care bracelet. As we are experiencing a dengue and influenza epidemic, I knew we would have to wait. However, this wait was 3h20. Several non-urgent people passed by beforehand. There were more than 100 people for 4 doctors. When I was finally seen, the doctor wanted to give me medicine for which, and I had no symptoms, I didn't like the service.  I was in a lot of pain and had a rising fever. After this service, I waited to take the medication and do 2 tests, influenza and blood count. And amazingly, wait another 2 hours for the results and another medical appointment.After waiting, another doctor, very attentive, by the way, commented on the results of the blood count, saying that it was stable, platelets and leukocytes, etc. He printed the result and gave it to me. At the time I didn't even look at the paper, I just wanted to go home. It was already 2 am. Detail, they charged me R$115 for parking.Today, I had an appointment with my obstetrician, who asked for the CBC results. When I went to send the exam, I didn't have the blood count! Only liver function, hematocrit and h1n1. To assess the impact of dengue, she needed to know about platelets and leukocytes. I called BP and they said that no one from the São Paulo unit would answer them, and I would open a call that would take 48 business hours to respond and that there was no point in me going in person to get the exam, as it is the same procedure as opening a call. ..they even insinuated that the exam had not been carried out. Conclusion I spent 7 hours in the ER for nothing, because I'm going to have to go to another hospital today to get my blood count. I spent more than 2 hours on the phone trying to find this test, and nothing... I made a very polite call to make a complaint to the ombudsman and amazingly, they hung up on me. I consider this treatment to be violence.I do not believe that this complaint has a solution or repair, but I wanted to warn those who, like me, considered the Beneficência Portuguesa hospital to be a good hospital, to reconsider and make another choice, if they have the opportunity.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Terrible hospital, awkwardness to be attended to by a receptionist who circulates with you for 36 minutes instead of taking you to theDoctor for return, doctor who doctors you without asking what you have, then when you resume the evaluation the other doctor hasTo do the work of the first one, who didn't even manage to ask what you had,They put me on medication because I was lying on the floor in front of the office.Unfortunately, I want to move forward with the process.Against the doctor who attended and communicate theOmbudsman of the incidentWard chairs allBroken, in short, I have never been so humiliated and so embarrassed to have a service

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil

I questioned the reception and they came with several meaningless excuses.Undue charges, where exams are carried out without informing that they are charged. To inquire, they advised calling the ombudsman's office, which no one answered.The wait was too long, at reception it said 1:30 hour wait, but it took almost 3 hours for us to be called. Always like this.If you want to be angry, go to Beneficência Portuguesa!

Review Text: We are from the interior of Paraná, Cascavel. We were able to schedule an urgent exam for my 6 year old son (who is not eating due to the severity of the problem that needed to be confirmed by the exam)We called on April 2nd when we found out we needed the exam.On 04/08 they called me informing me that they had found a time, on 04/18 at 8am and to arrive 1 hour in advanceSo I bought plane tickets, at the non-refundable rate because it was accurate and I wasn't going to cancel, I booked a Hotel (no refund), Car and Parking (no refund) In this case it was a little more than 4 thousand reais for 2 days.The flight would leave Foz on the 17th at 10am and return on the same day as the exam, 04/18 at 5pmHowever, on April 16th, at around 3pm, they called me informing me that they couldn't do the exam, and even the attendant couldn't explain the real reason, firstly that the machine broke down and then another department would get in touch shortly afterwards, but that didn't happen. !I called again, where another attendant told me that the exam was confirmed, so I reported what happened on the first call, and then other excuses started to appear and went from sector to sector, where they didn't even know what to say!Then she told me to go, that if there was enough time MAYBE they would do the exam at 3pm and I was supposed to go, luckily since I had already bought the tickets!Total negligence, if you plan to do an EXAM (it wasn't a trip), with a sick child and at the last minute the hospital cancels itI was left at a loss due to the Hospital's lack of commitment and seriousness, and not even a concrete answer as to the real reason for the cancellation! If they didn't want to take it, they shouldn't have made an appointment, in addition to making them wait 10 days for the exam, canceling at the last minute!

Review Text: My experience was terrible. It was always bad. Service, waiting time is surreal, stressful for both consultation and examination and even worse for surgery.All the attendants don't have a minimum of empathy, a minimum of organization...The information provided is divergent.Employees do not have the minimum knowledge to provide the correct information...Elective surgery and when the patient is in the RPA room they go to request a room and then discover that there is NO room available, outside they keep saying that the patient is still in surgery but has already left surgery just to save time.Waiting time was over 18h...When I tried to complain I was not heard and I had to hear that I had to wait and the patient in the RPA room had been awake for 5 hours, impatient, hungry...And they did absolutely nothing.He has no empathy whatsoever, total inhumanity, no respect whatsoever for patients and companions who are already suffering psychologically.Delayed service.Private hospital, elective surgery and NO ROOM AVAILABLE....And to make matters even worse, after more than 5 hours in the RPA room, a room was made available after much effort and struggle, it still took another 2h30 to take the patient to the room as there was no TRANSPORTATION TEAM available.Surgery ended at 7:30 pm and he stayed in the RPA and went to the room only at 2:00 am (morning).Note: entered the CC at 12:30 pm, surgery scheduled for 1:00 pm.The surgery only started at 3:30 pm as the operating room was not yet ready.That's absurd.It wasn't just me, more than 10 people were waiting with the same problem.Bad logistics...I only regret a hospital of this size, a reference but not fulfilling it.Regrettable, a total DISREGARD towards the patient and companion.And the worst, an elective surgery scheduled more than 30 days agoThe surgery was only performed at this hospital because I trust the doctor.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Throughout my journey in search of professional opportunities, I came across an experience that powerfully illustrates the importance of humanization and compliance with processes in the corporate environment, especially during the selection process. Applying for a job at BP proved to be a remarkable experience, but for all the wrong reasons.From the first contact with the Recruitment and Selection department, the lack of care and consideration for candidates was evident. Communication was scarce and unclear, often leaving me in the dark about the status of the process and the next steps to be taken. Such disorganization not only generated frustration, but also cast doubt on the effectiveness and seriousness of the company as a whole.The lack of humanization became even more evident during the few moments I interacted with HR representatives. The analysts responsible for the process, Tácia Giaretta and Cristina Vieira, demonstrated an alarming disregard, relegating me to oblivion and treating my concerns with indifference. The absence of empathy and genuine interest in my application was disconcerting and disheartening, undermining any prospect of a positive professional relationship.Furthermore, when trying to remedy the situation and seek a solution to the problems faced, I came across an even more disconnected and uncommitted leadership. Coordinator Tatiane Cortez, although aware of the deficiencies in service and processes, appeared inert and had little interest in resolving the issue, leaving me at the mercy of the ineffectiveness and lack of professionalism of her analysts who permeated the HR department.Given this experience, it is impossible to ignore the harmful consequences of the lack of humanization and non-compliance with processes in the workplace. The negligence demonstrated by BP HR not only compromises the candidate experience, but also undermines the credibility and integrity of the organization as a whole. After all, how can we expect front-line employees to follow the company's guidelines and values ​​when those responsible for PEOPLE MANAGEMENT themselves fail to do so?Ultimately, my interaction with BP not only made it clear that it is not a suitable place to work, but also highlighted the urgency of a profound overhaul of the Recruitment and Selection approach to communication, humanization and process compliance. Only in this way will it be possible to build a truly inclusive, collaborative work environment oriented towards mutual success.

Review Text: During hospitalization, on the third floor, I was very well looked after by the Nursing Team, like Reginaldo and others, I felt very well looked after by them, I stayed for about 4 days, thank GOD for professionals willing to help and who enjoy their work, they made it easier The days I needed to stay a lot, the Nursing and Resonance Team, were 10, very patient and diligent.The multidisciplinary medical team were also very attentive, the ENT team, a 10 from the emergency room, and visited every day until discharge, in addition to cardiology, neuro, which they also visited every day, very grateful to everyone, they were excellent 10.I just didn't give it 5 stars, due to the structure of the hospital itself, from the emergency room, to the moment of waiting for admission, during this period where the patient has to wait is not very pleasant, this I believe is a more administrative part, but knowing Being admitted to hospital is no longer easy, and staying in an unfriendly place while waiting for a room doesn't help. Review Text: Do not take exams at BP in São Paulo.  Results are extremely difficult to achieve, the attendants are completely lost.  I called 5 times and each one told me different information. In a hospital, the SAC should be completely different from a SAC at an appliance store, which looks for a hospital in need of care, often urgent, but above all, human. Review Text: My husband had an oncological Pet Scan exam last Saturday, March 9th. At the time, they informed us that the results would be released yesterday, the 13th, and could be retrieved online. When trying to access it, we found that it was not available.  I called customer service 35051000 three times. The first attendant asked my husband to be nearby to authorize the password reset. I went to look for him. The second attendant confirmed her presence, said she would do the reset and the call was disconnected. The third attendant, Fernanda, carried out several procedures and in the end, although I received the email with the link, she stated that I could only access it via computer and not via cell phone. I got home and checked my email, and the links didn't work. This morning I called again and the attendant Valéria sent a new link and asked me to try accessing it in other browsers. I tried them ALL. None give access.  Open a bagNo response and I called the center again. The attendant dropped the call after 25 minutes of waiting. We live 240km from the capital.  An oncology exam, in itself, is a source of tension and worry. This impossibility of access is an absolute lack of respect for the patient.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Poor service from start to finish!On 02/17/24 Upon arriving at 03:04, I took the password and ALONE at the reception I waited 20 minutes to go through the screening, and I only went through because I was SICK. I got up and went to the room to check if there were nurses there and how to get there. wait, there wasn't. With that, I asked the receptionist, who was EXTREMELY RUDE, to call the nurse over the radio to go to the department and start the service.After 4 calls on the radio, the nurse from triage 2 responded and appeared, apologizing for the delay and saying that she was having trouble turning on the computer, which was a lie, as I myself had checked if there was anyone in the room and there wasn't.Passing by the reception, the receptionist only took my card and never asked for my photo ID. Which is absurd, as it could have been someone else using my insurance, but we continued the service with almost 40 minutes of entry.Arriving in the lilac sector, there was ONE doctor attending, Dr. Carla, so there were elderly people in front of me, after another 30 minutes I was seen and taken to the medication and exam room for dengue fever.Arriving there at 4:34 am (more than 1 hour and a half from arrival), wonderful nurse Maria de Lourdes noticed that I had a fever, took my temperature and verified that the medications prescribed by Dr. Carla had nothing for this symptom, so She went to the room and was received by Dr. Carlos, as they had changed shifts.Dr. Carlos then ordered me to stop taking the medications prescribed by Dr. Carla, and I had already taken 70%, as he said it was contraindicated for those with suspected dengue fever and replaced it with dipyrone.I finished the medications and spent another hour waiting for the test results to come out, then another 40 minutes waiting for Dr. Carlos to call for reevaluation. AN ABSURD! When looking at the results of the tests, the Dr. himself went to the laboratory, as he said that the tests did not "match". The results didn't make sense to him and so he asked me to take the tests again...Doctors do not trust doctors, doctors change medications prescribed by doctors themselves and doctors do not believe the results of their own laboratory tests.I went in at 3am and it was already 6am and I didn't know what I had, and to find out I would have to start all over again. In pain, hungry and paying for a service offered by a hospital with no organization and with totally unprepared professionals.I give it a 1 because I can't give it a 0! TERRIBLE from beginning to end!

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: It was the first time my mother went to a consultation. My 70-year-old mother arrived super tight to go to the bathroom and couldn't get through the turnstile to access a toilet until she got an ID.After getting her identification and queuing with her documentation, we received a map to get to the sector. I arrived in front of the office where there were approximately 5 to 8 armchairs and sat down... I stayed there for approximately 15 minutes when I read in small letters that before being called to the office I should go to a counter located in a room behind the place in that we were.When I got there I was waiting for a few minutes when the doctor came to speak to the receptionist and he said that we were there waiting to register.We were reprimanded as if we had arrived late for the appointment, something super unpleasant for those who arrived 23 minutes before the appointment and due to a lack of kindness and information we went through such embarrassment.The situation was worse after the consultation.My mother needed to go to the bathroom again just like me. Soon after, we went downstairs and I went to validate the parking which, according to the girl, for 5 minutes I paid for another full hour totaling 55.00.When I finished paying, I remembered that I needed a time statement for my work, I left my 70-year-old mother sitting and went to the entrance counter to make that request where I needed to queue again. When I was attended to, I was advised to return to the sector, but the place on the 3rd floor was already closed. I was advised to go to the hospital, which also couldn't give me a statement about the length of my stay accompanying my mother to the consultation. I was even ridiculed because Adriano, the attendant, maintained the stance that only Mr. Jorge could resolve the issue and that he should already be in his home 🏠.It is truly unacceptable for a person to be inside a hospital 🏥 with registration and entry tag, scheduled medical appointment and not be able to obtain a declaration of their attendance to accompany the 70-year-old mother who recently suffered a HEMORRHAGIC CVA in an appointment with the geriatrician.In other words, after working until 4:30 pm I will have one day off, losing my pay, because at HOSPITAL BENEFICÊNCIA PORTUGUESA, even though you are inside the hospital 🏥 with the patient, just because the department closed while we were in the bathroom at 8:30 pm at night, there is no more no one else capable or qualified to issue a time statement.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I saw Dr Marcela, who made me extremely uncomfortable during the consultation by speaking to me aggressively, thinking it was my obligation to know things I had never had contact with and raising her voice when I said that I was surprised by the results of the tests because of the complaints I presented. They didn't relate to what she was saying, wanting help for the pain I've been feeling for days, she then replied “I'm not asking, I'm stating”. Towards the end of the consultation, when I asked her a question and she was again harsh, I told her that I wasn't comfortable with that, and she said she was speaking sweetly and that she understood that I was stressed because of the pain, but in that At that moment I wasn't even in pain anymore since I had been medicated and I didn't even have the strength to be stressed because I was feeling so weak. I gave up explaining because I realized she wouldn't understand.I was stressed when at 4 am, to go to the hospital I was told that I would be on a stretcher waiting 24 hours for a room or that I should count on luck, in the words of the nurses, to get one sooner.I wouldn't mind waiting, but 24 hours or luck???? I pay more for a medical plan with an apartment because being in a hospital is very uncomfortable, thinking about that I just wanted to rest after spending almost 10 hours doing a lot of tests and not knowing what I had.When I said I was going home, they made me sign a waiver stating that I was aware of the consequences that the doctor had given me, but no doctor came to talk to me about my case or give me guidance since I wanted to go home. rest. I continue to have the same symptoms, without being able to eat or drink water... despite having signed the form, I know that I need medical care and I would really like to have received it, but I'm not going to “count on luck” in a hospital of this size

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Only now did I have the courage to leave my review here. I'm Pablo's girlfriend, a patient who was hospitalized at BP for several days. He passed away due to the condition being extremely serious and he did not respond to treatment. Through this evaluation, I express my enormous gratitude to the doctors and nurses at the hospital. I wish I could go back, just to leave flowers or chocolate, but I haven't been able to yet. In any case, they took great care of our boy, from start to finish. The nurse let me stay with him, and even though he was so bedridden, he laughed at her jokes, the doctor talked to us and even got emotional. Everyone was doing everything for him. And this makes us so calm, because we know we did everything possible, but when God has a plan there is nothing we can do. We will never forget the team, we will never forget the affection and we will forever be grateful for everything! He rested from all suffering and you were angels, and I know that God was and is with you every step of the way! 🩶 Thank you very much!!!

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: A large, beautiful hospital, with a renowned history, but today it has the same problems as other hospitals considered bad.On Jan 4, 24, I called customer service to schedule an ultrasound for myself, which would be performed by my health plan.Like everything the first time, without knowing the process, I asked if I needed anything other than my documents and the doctor's order to carry out the aforementioned exam. The attendant said no, that she would only need to send the aforementioned documents to the hospital's email address and the exam schedule would be confirmed.On the same day, I sent my document with photo, health insurance card and medical request. I then received a message confirming the exam schedule for 6 Jan 24, at 8:45 am.On Friday, I asked via email from the hospital if I would need an authorization guide to carry out the exam the next day, as I had been told by friends at work, but I was given no guidance.I woke up at 5:30 am on Saturday and went to the location an hour before to take the exam, and after waiting 30 minutes I was seen, and to my surprise, I needed such an authorization form from my health plan to be able to take the exam, if Otherwise, the private value would be discounted.Now, why didn't they tell me this before? Was that the intention, to make me show up at the location and take the exam anyway?I wasted my time and money traveling only to find out that I could not take the requested exam with the documents presented, even though I had already sent the documents and asked about the guide via email previously.I know that as a patient I have no obligation to know about the hospital's procedures, so I asked about it. If I was given the wrong advice, the loss should have been the hospital's and not mine.In the uncertainty of being able to obtain the authorization form from my health plan, I stopped taking the exam and now only God knows when I will be able to schedule an appointment at another hospital.Unfortunately for me now, this Hospital Beneficência Portuguesa only has a name and appearance.
