Review Text: A horror show!If you have a choice, stay away from this hospital.Everything is extremely time-consuming, the hospital is full, you have to keep taking medication for inpatients and keep charging the nurses (who go out of their way to provide care, but there are many beds for few employees), the cleaning of the hospital is a joke, the apartment's bathroom looks like a cave, with an unbearable musty stench.The PS observation beds are extremely uncomfortable, for family members and companions the situation gets worse, everything is a nuisance. If you need to go to this circus, leave your car in the parking lot outside the hospital.The clinical staff is good, but it is lost in this lack of hospital administration.Finally, avoid it if you can.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: On 10/25, approximately 10:30 am, Lucia Maria Freire Mainente was admitted to the Emergency Room at Hospitral Beneficencia Portuguesa with severe abdominal pain due to intestinal diverticulitis, through the Bradesco health plan, with the right to an apartment.After waiting for more or less 1 hour, she was seen by a very attentive doctor on duty, laboratory tests, tomography and medication to alleviate the pain were requested, and she was referred for this.After waiting for more than an hour, the exams and tomography were carried out, the patient waited to be treated in a narrow and uncomfortable armchair, the results would be sent directly to the requesting doctor.At 9:00 pm she had still not received medication (more than 10 hours after having entered the ER with severe pain, and sitting in an uncomfortable armchair), her companion (husband and health plan holder) requested the test results because would take the patient to another hospital, waiting more than 10 hours to be medicated, feeling pain, which is beyond any justifiable situation, so with the nursing insistence on medicating and sending her to hospitalization immediately and the difficulties we would have in transporting her to another hospital, we accepted the nursing request, she remained in the medication room for a few more hours until she was taken to a Box in Observation 2 of the PS, where there were several Boxes and in each Box only one bed and a chair (no space for a feeding tray, bag, etc., with the promise that when there was a bed available that would qualify, it would be sent.That's how the rest of the night was on the 25th, 26th and 27th, in the noisy BOx with the conversations of employees, patients, the commotion of construction staff who constantly pass through the corridor and the companion sleeping in a chair.On the night of the 27th, she was finally transferred to room 3812, which did offer some comfort to the patient, but on the night of the 28th, with a false claim of the need for room maintenance, she was transferred to room 3207, located right in front of the nursing station that had employees talking all night long, the window blinds didn't close and in front there was another hospital building with the luxes on, light that shined directly into the patient's eyes and companion, the bathroom had a very strong musty smell.Out of suspicion that they had taken advantage of the fact that the patient and companion were elderly, I called the intercom in the previous room and another patient was occupying the room.This was the treatment given by Hospital Beneficencia Portuguesa to an elderly couple, they thought we would accept all of this in silence.I make it clear that the nursing, nutrition and cleaning staff were at all times very helpful, polite and humane, however the administration of both the PS and the Hospitalization were very inhumane.It now remains to be seen whether the Hospital will charge the health plan operator for every day as an apartment stay or whether they will act with a minimum of honesty, at least with the health plan.Note: This information will also be transmitted to the health plan operator.

Review Text: Terrible...totally irresponsible hospital.On 08/08/23 I was in the PS, my partner had high blood pressure all day, we went there at night...first and last time.She passed the screening, pressure 15x9, they placed a yellow emergency bracelet on her. They sent her to the measurement room because she would give the pill and she waited a long time and nothing for a pill. She went to the room to ask and they said she had to wait, so she asked the nurse, can I leave? Answer do you have the recipe? She answered yes and the nurse said she could go, but they didn't medicate her, nor did they measure her blood pressure again to see if everything was ok with her blood pressure, in other words, what did we go there to do?Tremendous irresponsibility, we got home and went to measure it and it was the same as when we were admitted to the hospital, look at the risk they put on people's lives, after all they studied for thisApart from the disregard for other patients she saw inside, patients screaming in pain and no one providing assistance.A B S U R D O

Review Text: UNCOMFORTABLE WITH THE TERRIBLE SERVICE FROM THE PNEUMOLOGY DEPARTMENT OF BP HOSPITAL - MORE THAN 3 MONTHS OF WAITING FOR CONSULTATION:On 10/05, I requested an appointment with a Pulmonologist at BP Hospital and was informed that the earliest date available was 12/07. Today, 7/11, the day before my appointment, I was informed that my appointment was canceled due to the doctor's unavailability. I requested to reschedule, and was informed that the earliest available date is now 08/30. Considering that the cancellation was made by the doctor/Hospital BP, I requested an appointment as soon as possible, as I am an oncology patient and have lung failure as a result of cancer treatment. However, I was informed by the attendant that the doctor does not authorize fittings, even in these circumstances. I registered an incident with the Ombudsman reporting what happened and requesting action, considering that I have been waiting for 2 months and, on the verge of waiting for another 1 month and 18 days, totaling the wait of 3 months and 18 days for A CONSULTATION WITH A PNEUMOLOGIST, at BP Hospital. At the end of recording the incident, the Ombudsman informed me that, "IF" there is a return, it will be given within 5 working days. I am unhappy with the terrible service provided by the pulmonology department at BP Hospital. I feel a total disregard for my health and my current condition. The conduct of everyone involved (hospital, doctor, scheduling attendant and ombudsman) is extremely regrettable.

Review Text: . Terrible experience. 06/19/23 ER crowded and a patient was visibly about to faint at the door of the medication room, with staff coming in and out and no one was touched by her appearance. (zero humanization). I asked the administrative attendant MARCELA for help, who answered me sharply: "If you're feeling unwell, go in there and talk to the nurse." (zero reception and zero education). That's what I did: I went into the room, spoke to the nurse but he didn't pay attention either. (humanization and zero reception). I went to the girl who was feeling ill, offered help and sat her down in a chair. I stood and watched the movement in the medication room and no one came to help the girl. After about 15 minutes she was called and I informed her that she was without a companion and that she was unable to stand.  They brought a wheelchair and the girl passed out on her way to the emergency room. I went to complain to Marcela, she shouted at me in the 2 flow A waiting room, saying that it was not her role to provide reception as she was merely an administrative person and had this guidance from her two medical bosses to whom I could complain directly. I argued that I did not request technical assistance, but rather someone to contact someone to confirm whether the girl needed prioritized assistance and she, in addition to being rude, outsourced the service for me to do. She continued screaming wildly at me, without any emotional control. It's incredible how there is an immense value in what BP publishes about QUALITY AND CERTIFICATIONS and the harsh reality. People unqualified and unprepared for this important activity that is performed mechanically, ignoring human beings. Amazingly, even in the face of the scandal, no one from management showed up to see what was happening. Literally "house without an owner".  I remain in the PS accompanying my family member, also in a wheelchair, and no one gives me any satisfaction. Regrettable06/19/23 - 9:58pm

R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I went to the adult PS on Saturday 10/06 in the evening around 8:20 pm. I had a terrible experience with medical care.The service at reception and screening were super fast, I was very satisfied with the agility. However, upon entering the room of the doctor who goes by the name of Dr. Ana Cecília (clinician), she asked what I was feeling. I was having a lot of pain in my back, stitches in my right breast, tingling, and extreme sensitivity in both parts, I couldn't even put on a bra. The doctor pressed the area and immediately diagnosed me with muscle pain. I told her that it wasn't muscle pain, I knew very well the pain I was feeling. On a scale of 0 to 10, I was in pain as an 8.I asked if we could do an exam for a better diagnosis. She refused me. I asked for an x-ray and said it wasn't necessary since I didn't have any broken bones, otherwise I wouldn't be lifting my arm in pain. Well, from my layman's knowledge, an x-ray doesn't just check for broken bones, pneumonia is also detected through an x-ray exam, for example. Anyway, I insisted on a blood test and again I was denied. He prescribed me an anti-inflammatory and a muscle relaxant.I didn't leave my house on a Saturday night to be diagnosed with just a squeeze on my back. The pain was tremendous. I left the room frustrated, my indignation is that I didn't ask to see another doctor, because I believe it's very easy to be a doctor like that. Stay tuned guys, ask for tests and not assumptions. I still bought the medicines prescribed by her, I only spent money. Because it wasn't muscle pain. But I took it to see if it relieved the pain and it didn't help! The next day, with even more pain and more sensitivity and stitches in my breast, I went to another adult PS hospital! During the screening, they took me to do an emergency electrocardiogram, while I left my ID and insurance card with the receptionist, I did the electrocardiogram, the doctor promptly examined me with patience and care, analyzed my skin and symptoms (she didn't even do that) , I did an x-ray and blood tests to give an accurate diagnosis as he said. And finally, I was diagnosed with Herpes zoster. In other words, if I hadn't returned to the ER in another hospital, I would have been in agony with pain. I was medicated with Tramal, serum and two other medications that I don't remember the name of now! I remained under observation and was discharged with a prescription for antiviral treatment and pain medication. And if the pain persists, I must return to see the infectious disease specialist! Quite a difference from the service I received at BP. I was extremely disappointed.I gave two stars because the reception was quick to open the form, waiting time and screening as well. The hospital is very well signposted.Stay tuned guys and ask for tests so you don't go home with pain and nothing resolved. I don't think anyone goes to the hospital to go for a walk and waste time, especially on a Saturday night when I could have been doing something else, I only really went because I was in a lot of pain. Revolting.

Review Text: Hospital Beneficência Portuguesa, Maestro Cardim unit, is carrying out completely illegal activities in relation to the admissions of child patients.Patients have health insurance and authorization to stay in rooms during hospitalizations, in our case our daughter is just 5 years old, with a broken arm, awaiting surgery. Upon arriving at the location, they carry out the entire procedure, making you wait for around 3 hours. At the end of the process, at the time of admission to the children's Emergency Room, they inform that they are in high demand and do not offer rooms, but rather screens, divided by curtains, for several children, accompanied by adults, even those without masks.According to the nursing team, it is something constant and repeated, including treatment in the ER itself.In the same children's emergency room environment, infected and uninfected children, as well as family members, cohabit, placing the latter at risk of infection and prolonging hospital stays, increasing mortality and morbidity.When looking for the responsible supervisor, he was not there. One of the sector's employees spoke to someone internally, who does not serve the public, and informed that the room was expected to be released within 24 hours - one day paid for the room, kept in screens, posing a health risk.Complete absurdity and neglect.

Review Text: A good MT hospital. Clean, organized, trustworthy from the moment you enter. Great service from the nursing and medical reception. Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Horrible, terrible service, my mother-in-law, who is 82 years old, had to wait around 4 hours to be admitted to the hospital to carry out a procedure, where she asked to be in gejum, subject to legal proceedings, this situation is ridiculous, the service is of very poor quality from where They should have focused on human beings, and it simply became a financial trade, only aimed at profit, very disgusting.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I was admitted to the bp PS on 03/30. They told me that I would be admitted immediately but it would take about 30 hours to get to the room.I spent those 30 hours in a ward with the air conditioning turned on full blast, which I don't understand as it shouldn't be good for anyone's health.Finally, they said that I would go to the temporary room and then to the permanent room and I asked more than 2 times to speak to the hospital because I am willing to pay the difference. But no one came to talk to me.I have dengue and covid, very low platelets, isolated in a place that looks more like a closet than a room, with no window, no fridge to cool water. There is no table for me to put my luggage on. The dining table sideboard is broken. the device that hangs the IVs has filthy feet. I'm here with a dirty bathroom shared with more than 20 people and I don't even have the courage to take a shower. Hygiene is crucial for health!!! Worse still, I still have to measure my urine and this makes everything more difficult when using a dirty bathroom!This looks like sus, not a hospital covered by sulamerica!Worse, I was admitted here 2 months ago for surgery and on every floor I went there were several free rooms. It doesn't make sense not to have a place for me to stay!my original bed that I paid for Sulamerica is for 2 people, not a ward with 30 people!!!I spoke to Simone from bp on the phone and she was very kind, calmed me down and said that I am a priority, but I don't think you are doing enough. In my condition, my whole body hurts, itches, I'm sick and lying on a hard stretcher seems like something the worst hospitals in the SUS do to patients. I'm sure there are excellent hospitals out there that give the patient more dignity.this is inhumane and cruel.Ah, I wanted to complain about the nursing team in the first ward I stayed in. I counted more than 2 liters of urine and they only recorded 1.4, which meant that my doctor did not release part of the serum into the vein. yet another cruelty.It's 9:40 pm and I still haven't received my dinner. not even 2 medicines!!!!Furthermore, I only have praise for the patience and politeness of many employees, especially my doctor and Gabriela at the hospital.If BP has such a huge demand it should be better managed!

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Excellent hospital, in fact it is first world, it just needs to retrain the nursing service in the cardiac ICU, more precisely the night shift staff, as some professionals seem to not like dealing with people, especially if they are bedridden and in need of your services. The day staff are much better, they should follow the example of the professional named Cristiano, this was the best I saw during my stay at BP. I congratulate the hospital for the excellent service, but nothing is unanimous, there is always something to be corrected!

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Horrible treatment, my mother went to the emergency room at midnight, a medical error, they were going to use a defibrillator on her and it was on another patient, if she hadn't been following up, they would have used the doctor at the time out of fear of us suing, she came to talk and admitted the error, total incompetence and due to her age, she would need put in an access through the central vein, the vascular doctor only arrived in the morning and then another doctor came and did another access in short my mother passed away it took a long time to give the medicine I needed it was the most horrible day of my life life, even if I'm dying, I'm going to this hospital, a nurse took pills from the floor and macerated them on a counter. I complained at the time, on the contrary, Osvaldo Cruz da Vergueiro treated my mother with dignity and solidarity, from the doctors and nurses to the physiotherapists, all very humane and excellent, it's a shame I made the wrong choice when taking them to the emergency room.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil

Review Text: I've been a worthy member since I was 11 years old and I have nothing to complain about!It's a shame that the government vetoed the continuation of this opportunity for other generations like my son and company....And whenever I have the opportunity, I don't fail to register with SAC or the partners' sector... as we have to warn, alert and charge on all aspects, so that BP Paulista continues to be a reference for all of us...

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Terrible!! I arrived at the PS at 11am due to eye irritation, typical of conjunctivitis. I made the appointment, took an serum and took tests. I waited until 10:24 pm in the queue for return service after the results of the blood tests, which were ready at 7 pm.I ended up giving up on staying to be seen upon return. More than 12 hours in the emergency room because of simple conjunctivitis! Something that could be done in a couple of hours if it took too long. Unbelievable! I wasted the whole day here and couldn't even be properly attended to. I left the hospital tired, stressed, I spent money on transportation and food for nothing to leave without even a prescription for eye drops. Another time I had conjunctivitis, I went to SUS and within an hour I was seen and already had the prescription in hand. Here in more than 12 hours I just got really stressed. This is ridiculous! Total disrespect!

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: My experience of a few months is of Life...They are excellent...all without exception

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Hospital scores a thousand!The staff is incredible, from cleaning people to management people.Super quick hospitalization, attentive doctors, nurses who are humanized and polite.I highly recommend it, the cleanliness of this place is wonderful, if you leave it you can eat on the floor, the sheets are whiter than paper, they are so clean.I didn't have any problems, just the insurance that involves hospitalization, but this varies a lot for each person.Thank you for everything and everyone!Beneficência Portuguesa Paulista is the best hospital I've ever been to.💕

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I do not recommend the exam department to anyone, especially if it is urgent. They are absolutely irresponsible. It's shameful, especially since it's a service that deals with people's lives.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I spent the worst days of my life in this place as my mother's companion. They wanted to discharge my mother, we said that she wasn't well enough to be discharged, she couldn't stand up on her own and they decided to leave it for another day. Review Text: I underwent surgery and received one of the worst care possible.Upon arrival at the surgery, everything was ok, but after the surgery, even though I complained of a lot of pain, no one gave me a sedative or anything similar to alleviate the pain considerably. When I went to the room, I needed help several times and the night nurses were super helpful. However, around 8am, my access dropped and was grating on the floor and I called the nurse, who called the room asking what I wanted and I said I lost my access and she told me to wait. I called again after a while and nothing, then 2 hours later my doctor called me and I told him and finally the nurse came to help. He said he sent photos of the access to the hospital board. She wanted to connect the same bags to my arm but I didn't let her, because the access was scraping the floor and only God knows how dirty it is, so she changed them when I complained. I spent 2 hours without serum, without medication and had just undergone surgery.As I walked around the floor to move, I noticed that the access support had defective wheels, so I asked for them to be replaced and they did nothing.Furthermore, I paid extra to stay in individual accommodation, my 82-year-old mother stayed with me and they didn't even give us the option of paying for a separate meal for her, which is absurd.In the room there was no list of extensions for reception, nutrition, etc. so I didn't even have a phone to complain. everything went through the nurses and nurses and they clearly filtered my requests.Finally, when I was discharged, we asked someone for help to get our bags and we waited for more than an hour until someone arrived. I had to use one of my legs to lift my suitcase off the sofa, I made my mother with mobility problems push my suitcase and she left there in a very bad mood and I don't judge her. A nurse accompanied us and we told her everything that happened, but I think it still shouldn't have been passed on.Here is my indignation with the service and with most of the nurses on the floor where I stayed.I hope the service improves substantially. It's absurd that they invested so much in facilities and the service is bad.

When moving post-surgery to the room, the nurse took me to the hospitalization room, which was occupied by another person. When the nurse finally found out where my new room was, she asked me to get off the stretcher alone onto the bed, which hurt a lot and made me cry, and I believe it aesthetically damaged my scar. Only after all this suffering alone did I find my family. The surgery was in April 22, since the beginning of May 22 they have been claiming a new hospital expense, outside the previously paid budget, with exams that they should have charged to the health plan. I certainly do not recommend this renowned hospital to anyone.

Review Text: On 10/04/22 I made contact by phone to schedule an endoscopic exam, confirmation was made for 10/13/22, I sent via email the request for release of the exam by the agreement. For this examination, the corresponding preparation was required, suspending the use of medications 5 days before, and the day before consuming liquid meals until 10 pm. On the day of the exam, I arrived on time and went through the entire check-in process. Upon completion, I was informed that I could not carry out the procedure because the time allotted for the release of the agreement had not passed...How do you confirm a date without being aware of the days needed for the agreement to be released?After being denied service, I was informed to reschedule the exam over the phone, I immediately went to the sector, the earliest date to reschedule is 10/27/22, I asked each employee in the sectors where they referred me and no one had an explanation. for what happened. I finally filed a complaint with the ombudsman's office, they took the data so that the person responsible could give a position and an immediate solution, but to this day I'm still waiting for a response.A lot of lack of responsibility, humanization and respect from BP Hospital towards the patient. They simply omit their error and leave the patient as if nothing had happened, and the patient can turn around.

Review Text: Please make sure it reaches everyone involved:My wife has multiple sclerosis, diagnosed in 2014. That's why she frequently undergoes MRI scans for control. From the first time he had a strong phobia of the machine, so he always had to do it with anesthesia. An inconvenience, to schedule, to carry out, discomfort afterwards, sore throat due to intubation, etc. Very bad.Saturday admitted him there, with an atypical occurrence that required investigation. Well, it started with the service at the PS, which was quick and objective. The doctor admitted us on Saturday night to do the exam. It was done early on Sunday morning, quickly.But hence the reason I posted this message:Guys, the quality of service was far, far above normal. The team was so committed, but so attentive, that she was able to do it without anesthesia.Please understand the importance of this and how it was a consequence of *excellence in service*.Fábio spoke to her beforehand, then congratulated her, Lais was absolutely fantastic! Fantastic! She held my wife's hand during the exam. It was too much. It was wonderful. The team was not only perfect, they went above and beyond what was required and did so well that she was able to undergo the exam without anesthesia.So the doctor came by on Saturday afternoon and asked for another session, the first was for the skull, he asked for a second for the spine and chest. In fact, the doctor was great too.Do you know what happened? The service was spectacular again! Now also with the presence of Daiane. Result: Did it without anesthesia again. Twice without anesthesia and that had never happened before.It was something very important in her life, which will have consequences from now on, because she will always have to take this exam. Scored.Thank you very, very much!Congratulations, you are professionals of the highest level!And as people, you did something very good for our lives, thank you very much!

Review Text: I was at bp paulista, on the 20th of 9th 2022 at 11 am feeling sick with nausea, headache and chest pain. I passed the screening and they took me immediately to the emergency room where I was very well looked after, a great doctor, a very attentive nurse, they examined me, they did an electro blood test, medication and asked for a tomography because I had brain aneurysm surgery last year. Then they sent me to the medication area to wait for the CT scan, where I waited for 4 hours. When the tests were ready, they sent me to a doctor who said that my tests were all normal, but as I wasn't well, they would ask for cardiac markers, and when they were ready, I had already changed the shift, another doctor said that everything was normal and passed. buscopam home. She took xeroxes of the exams, gave them to me along with the prescription, put them in my bag and went home. The next day I went to see the tests and saw that they weren't mine, they were from another patient, with the same first name as mine. Result So far I don't know the results of my cardiac markers, I don't know if I'm certified.

Review Text: In 1962, at the age of 6, I was diagnosed with cancer in the right kidney by the surgeon Dr Jarbas de Barros, it was in this hospital at a time when there was no ultrasound or resonance, that is, there was only X-ray, due to the doctor's skill and my symptoms he insisted on countless x-rays until he detected cancer in the right kidney, he immediately scheduled the surgery, including preparing a blood transfusion, in fact my blood is O negative. So I was admitted and the right kidney was removed, which actually had cancer, I can say that I was born again in this hospital, because 60 years ago it was very rare to cure cancer, it was a struggle, after the surgery I underwent treatment with oncologist Dr Antonio Carlos de Campos Junqueira where I underwent chemotherapy sessions and 48 radiotherapy sessions.  I am a survivor, I am now 66 years old, with 3 children and 5 grandchildren.  I am healthy for my age, but I am conscious and always take care of my health.I am part of the History of this hospital.

Review Text: I had orthognathic surgery on 07/06/2022 in this unit and was very well looked after by the doctors and nurses, but the nutrition team left me deeply frustrated.During hospitalization and at other times I said I was vegan, but they insisted on sending me products of animal origin... Initially they sent ice cream and Danone, with egg and milk in the composition, then the nutritionist came down to the room and asked to suspend it (later that I ate it!) but practically EVERY day they sent me beaten chicken soup, I could even feel the lint in the chicken...I, unable to speak, immobilized, fragile and with several limitations, had no strength to fight for a diet compatible with my life. The worst thing is that they still said "Vegan Patient" on the packaging but the inside was PURE CHICKEN.This is unacceptable. The hospital's medical and nursing staff are to be congratulated, but the nutrition team proved to be absolutely incompetent.If you are reading this and are thinking about having surgery and have any dietary restrictions, think carefully before choosing this hospital. What if I was allergic and had a bad time after surgery? BP's only response was "we are sorry that happened". They didn't even admit the mistake, nor did they apologize.To Portuguese charity: Review your processes and respect patient nutrition. I was sick, recovering, with a swollen face, and yet I wasn't treated with the decent food I deserve.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: It becomes increasingly difficult to carry out tests at BP, the delay starts at reception, with many people waiting to complete the form (laboratory tests, ultrasound and endoscopy are at the same reception, previously they were separate).When it comes to laboratory tests, it doesn't take that long after the form is filed.But ultrasound, bone densitometry, mammography and endoscopy take too long, and we only hear "excuses".Little by little I am migrating to another laboratory because the delay in service is stressful.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Very good organized place

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: My Experience happened yesterday (07/04/22), I needed to insert a Catheter to perform Chemotherapy, I went to the Emergency Room at 4pm.During the screening, he was quick and attentive.When filling out the registration as well.In general clinic care calm.But the hospitalization process was horrible, I sat waiting from 5pm to 10:30pm in the medication and observation ward and then at 10:30pm I was informed that I would have to spend the night sitting there in the armchair until before my surgery, as the hospital was crowded and there was no bed.     I would be in a medication chair and my companion would be in the chair, without a shower, without resting before surgery, I was offered a diet in the middle of all those people waiting to be seen and who were coughing, sneezing, and there were probably people with Covid.Stretchers with bedridden people, with medication, intubated, and with some type of monitoring were exposed to the public waiting for their turn there in the Subsoil 1 region, close to elevator 25. Very sad and with no privacy apart from the risk and exposure to contamination in that area, as there were people working in dirty clothes (clothes of a mechanic who injured his hand and had been waiting, poor thing, since 11:30 in the morning) and mixed with everything and everyone there. The Nurse who took my collection tied my arm with an elastic to make a tourniquet that hurt, and at no point sterilized her hand, she took the latex glove straight from the box inside a drawer of those support carts and the drawer was dirty with dust and debris of paper you could see.  The disorganization was clear and how the nurses and technicians were lost in the process, literally “banging their heads”. We went to complain to the hospitalization leader about the fact that there was no bed available and he told us that the deadline was 24 hours, and we were very lucky because there were already patients waiting for 48 hours (and he spoke as if that were acceptable, absurd, Mr Wesley !!!) .At that moment I asked for the cancellation of my hospitalization and the procedure and I saw that I wasn't the first, more than 20 people had already done the same, 3 families were trying to get an explanation from the same attendant and they were excited. A nurse even confirmed the chaos saying that they didn't even have clothes for the patient anymore!  This is regrettable, Administrators of such a renowned Hospital!Apart from the ABSURD price of parking inside, R$224.00 per day!! Where have you seen this????I DO NOT RECOMMEND, mainly due to the lack of organization and high risk of contamination to which we are exposed.

Review Text: When you check in they inform you of a value that they make you aware of (and mark this in their database), it happens that if you try to pay the bill on the same day that you are discharged, they refuse and then send a bill by email (only 2 months two) practically double what was informed to you on the day you received assistance.I wrote down the value that was informed and complained that this was not the value they told me when checking in at the hospital, even so they were adamant.Furthermore, it took me a while to be seen, because there were many patients for few doctors and staff and the air conditioning was freezing.I think they will charge an amount of almost 600 reais (in March 2022) just to take two packets of serum to at least provide better care.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I use BP for the convenience of being able to undergo consultations and exams in the same place. If you are going to do laboratory tests, take a thick book and a cell phone with a charged battery! The waiting time currently just for registration or the bureaucratic part (reception) is at least 1 hour 30 minutes, I have already waited more than 2 hours, I spoke to the manager that due to the delay, the 8 hour or 12 hour fast was exceeding a lot, She said she couldn't do ANYTHING, then you wait to be seen to collect the blood and hand over the other tests! If you have to fast, count on waiting two hours! The last terror I experienced at BP was on 18/05, I made an appointment with a doctor, it took me 2 months to get an appointment because I wanted to be seen by doctor M, however, the one who saw me was doctor B, look, I reiterated that I waited two months to be seen by doctor M! At reception the attendant said, everything is fine!To make matters worse, I had a routine exam that I've been doing for over 40 years, but this time the pain I felt was enormous! I informed the doctor's assistant and she said it was normal! Like this? The exam I took, BP informed me that if I wanted to have the result that it was my right, I would have to call FLEURY and wait for it to be sent via email, they didn't even give me a protocol for the delivery of the material!Bad experience!I intend to look for other accredited providers even if I don't have the convenience of having a consultation and exam in the same place! The service from the employees is excellent, in general from the medical team as well, except for those who put the status of doctor above the why and for what and who chose the profession of serving PEOPLE.They put themselves in the posture of superior Gods, the doctors, lol! The worm or the fire, wait for us in the same way to return to dust, lol.Good luck at BP

Review Text: On a Wednesday night, it took me 1 hour to get through the entrance counter, as there were about 4 people to pass in front of me and about 4 at reception to help. Then it took me another 1 hour to go to the appointment with the general practitioner and what surprised me most, another 1 hour waiting standing in front of the medication room to get an injection. Now, I don't judge the nurses or the staff working there because they were clearly understaffed and overworked and yet they were attentive to me. But I feel that in this particular hospital there is a lot of bureaucracy, the processes don't seem to be optimized or streamlined, everything is slow, the doctors spend more time filling out paperwork on the computer than assisting us and the same thing seems to happen at reception. In the medication room, there were few people to assist and a lot of people arriving, a bit of disorganization because some people arrived in a worse state and ended up passing in front of them. I think it would be extremely important for the Hospital to seriously look for a way to optimize its processes and reduce bureaucracy because I intend to change Hospitals after this situation.

Review Text: Wednesday, 3pm. Empty emergency room. They left my 68-year-old parents waiting for medical care for 7 hours. The São Caetano do Sul Municipal Emergency Room is more humane.

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: For the third time I am being disturbed, via email, by this hospital that DID NOT PROVIDE ME WITH CARE THE DAY I WAS THERE. I left the city of Mongaguá, in my brother's car, paying the toll and fuel for the trip and back, I spent TWO HOURS inside a screen with a plastic curtain, without anyone taking any action to assist me. I went up to the ground floor, announced that I was leaving due to lack of service, provided the necessary clarifications and outside I was still charged with a HUGE charge of 96.00 (NINETY-SIX REAIS) for two hours of parking, and I returned home much worse off than before. than when I entered the hospital. One of the emails they sent me (the second) charging 289.00 reais, had in red letters the threat of legal action if there was no payment. Payment for what?negligence in service, lack of responsibility, lack of professionalism? I hope that the management of this institution becomes aware of what happened, checks whether there is a medical record, what the medical diagnosis of my health problem was, what medication was given to me, what exam I underwent, what was the prescription that the doctor gave me... etc.  You will realize that THIS INFORMATION DOES NOT EXIST, simply because THERE WAS NO SERVICE.  If they still insist on continuing to harass me, there will only be the path of justice, and there I will claim compensation for MEDICAL NEGLIGENCE, UNDUE CHARGES, EMBRACEMENT AND MORAL HARASSMENT. Finally, search for my name and documents, how many times I have been to this hospital and whether I have ever stopped paying for my appointments. Own up to your mistakes and be more professional and more dignified!

Dealer Location: R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
R. Maestro Cardim, 637 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I underwent a series of tests at the diagnostic center and was impressed by the delay in care. They ask you to arrive 1 hour in advance to take the exams, but they wait more than 2 hours and a half to meet you. I don't know why they make appointments. I went for ultrasound and MRI exams on different days and it was always soooo long. Disrespect towards patients who are often waiting fasting to undergo certain tests or have other commitments.
